subject: Re: [junit] Re: Running Junit tests 'for dummies' tools/etc
msgSnippet: ... Why don t you hack together a simple GUI that calls the build internally? Do you need detailed error output? Or just a red/green light? A detailed output
messageBody:
On 2 August 2010 17:54, binarymonk01 <binarymonk01@...> wrote:
> Until then, the challenge is still the 'non-developer' to be able to invoke running the unit tests through a GUI they (a person familiar with M$ GUI screens) can run and understand. Â Command-line/console approaches are difficult to get acceptance for external users who are used to their GUI screens :-(

Why don't you hack together a simple GUI that calls the build internally?
Do you need detailed error output? Or just a red/green light?
A detailed output would be a little harder to get it pretty.
But I suppose it wouldn't be much trouble to parse the XML-JUnit
output from the junit ant task to print the error messages in pretty
enough.

Greetings,
Malte
